title: Together Final Trailer: Dave Franco & Alison Brie Can’t Be Separated
description: NEON has shared the Together final trailer for its newest body horror thriller led by real-life couple Dave Franco (Now You See Me) and Alison Brie (GLOW). The movie is scheduled to arrive in theaters on July 30. “Years into their relationship, Tim and Millie find themselves at a crossroads as they move to the […] The post Together Final Trailer: Dave Franco & Alison Brie Can’t Be Separated appeared first on ComingSoon.net - Movie Trailers, TV & Streaming News, and More.
author: Maggie Dela Paz
excerpt: The Together final trailer has dropped, teasing what to expect from upcoming Dave Franco and Alison Brie horror movie.
siteName: ComingSoon.net - Movie Trailers, TV & Streaming News, and More
text: NEON has shared the Together final trailer for its newest body horror thriller led by real-life couple Dave Franco (Now You See Me) and Alison Brie (GLOW). The movie is scheduled to arrive in theaters on July 30. “Years into their relationship, Tim and Millie find themselves at a crossroads as they move to the country, abandoning all that is familiar in their lives except each other. With tensions already flaring, a nightmarish encounter with a mysterious, unnatural force threatens to corrupt their lives, their love, and their flesh,” reads the official synopsis. Check out the Together final trailer below (watch more trailers): What happens in the Together final trailer? The video features Franco and Brie as a couple who starts experiencing a strange phenomenon with their bodies after moving to an unfamiliar place. Due to a mysterious force, their bodies keep connecting with each other no matter how hard they try to separate. The trailer continues to highlight some of the movie’s gory body horror sequences involving Franco and Brie’s characters. Together is written and directed by Michael Shanks. The cast also includes Damon Herriman as Jamie, Jack Kenny as Luke, Karl Richmond as Jordy, Tom Considine as Mr. Wilson, Melanie Beddie as Mrs. Wilson, Sarah Lang as Keri, Rob Brown as Chaplin, Mia Morrissey, and more. It is produced by Brie, Franco, Erik Feig, Mike Cowap, Andrew Mittman, Julia Hammer, Tim Headington, and Max Silva. Since its world premiere at the 2025 Sundance Film Festival earlier this year, the movie has received a Tomatometer rating of 100% on Rotten Tomatoes, based on 55 reviews.
html:
NEON has shared the Together final trailer for its newest body horror thriller led by real-life couple Dave Franco (Now You See Me) and Alison Brie (GLOW). The movie is scheduled to arrive in theaters on July 30.

“Years into their relationship, Tim and Millie find themselves at a crossroads as they move to the country, abandoning all that is familiar in their lives except each other. With tensions already flaring, a nightmarish encounter with a mysterious, unnatural force threatens to corrupt their lives, their love, and their flesh,” reads the official synopsis.

Check out the Together final trailer below (watch more trailers):

What happens in the Together final trailer?

The video features Franco and Brie as a couple who starts experiencing a strange phenomenon with their bodies after moving to an unfamiliar place. Due to a mysterious force, their bodies keep connecting with each other no matter how hard they try to separate. The trailer continues to highlight some of the movie’s gory body horror sequences involving Franco and Brie’s characters.

Together is written and directed by Michael Shanks. The cast also includes Damon Herriman as Jamie, Jack Kenny as Luke, Karl Richmond as Jordy, Tom Considine as Mr. Wilson, Melanie Beddie as Mrs. Wilson, Sarah Lang as Keri, Rob Brown as Chaplin, Mia Morrissey, and more. It is produced by Brie, Franco, Erik Feig, Mike Cowap, Andrew Mittman, Julia Hammer, Tim Headington, and Max Silva. Since its world premiere at the 2025 Sundance Film Festival earlier this year, the movie has received a Tomatometer rating of 100% on Rotten Tomatoes, based on 55 reviews.
